questions.text: Which of the following is not true about ventilation?

choices.text: Involves quality control of outgoing air

questions.solution:
Ventilation involves the quality control of incoming air but not quality control of outgoing air. 

It also involves the replacement of vitiated air(air with decreased oxygen content) by a supply of fresh outdoor air. It aims to provide a comfortable thermal environment and reduce the risk of infections.

questions.text: What is the ideal number of air changes in a drawing-room?
questions.solution:
The number of air changes in drawing rooms or living rooms must be 2 – 3 per hour.

The number of air changes in work rooms and assemblies must be 4 – 6 per hour.

questions.text: What is ventilation provided by wind blowing through a space called?
questions.solution:
Ventilation provided by wind blowing through a space is called perflation.

Ventilation can be broadly classified as natural and mechanical:

Natural ventilation includes:

  • Perflation is the ventilation of a space achieved by allowing wind to blow through it and removing the obstacles for this to happen (e.g., opening windows and doors).
  • Aspiration occurs when there is an obstruction as wind bypasses it and creates a suction action
  • Diffusion is the passage of air through small spaces or openings
  • Cross-ventilation is when air is allowed a natural path through the space by providing openings at appropriate places, opposite each other.

The drawback of natural ventilation is that regulation of air quality is not possible.

Mechanical ventilation includes:

  • Exhaust ventilation utilizes exhaust fans placed high up near the roof on the external walls. A vacuum is created by which fresh air enters the ventilated space.
  • Plenum ventilation uses centrifugal fans to blow fresh air into the room and create a positive pressure, by which vitiated air is pushed out.
  • Balanced ventilation is the combination of both exhaust and plenum methods of ventilation.
  • Air conditioning can be done through mechanical ventilation. It is the simultaneous control of all or at least three factors that influence air quality in a confined room or space. These factors include temperature, humidity, air movement, distribution, dust, bacteria, odours and toxic gases.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a social goal of housing standards?
questions.solution:
Prevention of non-infectious diseases is not a social goal of housing standards.

The social goals of housing include:

  • Shelter
  • Family life
  • Access to community facilities
  • Family participation in community life
  • Economic stability

questions.text: What is the optimum floor area recommended per adult in a living room?
questions.solution:
The optimum floor area recommended per adult person in a living room is 50 – 100 sq. ft.

Non-Rural Housing Standards in India:

Housing parameters

Description
Site

Elevated to protect from rains and floods.

Independent access to the street.

Away from vector breeding sites and other pollutants like smoke, noise, dust.

The soil on which it is founded must be dry and safe.
Floor A pucca floor that is impermeable, easy to clean, free from cracks, damp-proof. Height of plinth must be 2 – 3 feet.
Walls 9 inch thick, strong, low heat capacity, weather-resistant, unsuitable for harbourage of rats/vermin.
Roof Height not less than 10 feet (3m).
Rooms The number of rooms must be according to the size of the family. However, the basic number is two.
Floor area A living room should have at least 120 sq. ft. of area for occupancy of more than 1 person and 100 sq. ft. for occupancy of only one person. 50 -100 sq. ft. floor area per person is optimum in a living room.
Cubic space 500 – 1000 cubic feet of air space per capita.
Windows At least 2 windows per room with one opening into an open space. Windows must be at a height of not more than 3 feet above the ground. The window area must be 1/5th of the floor area.
Lighting The daylight factor should be >1% over half the floor area.
Sanitary privy Every house must have a sanitary privy.
Others Proper facilities for garbage disposal, bathing and washing and a good water supply.

questions.text: During a field visit, you explain about ideal living standards to the general public. Which of the following is false regarding windows in housing standards?

choices.text: At least 2 windows in each room
At a height more than 5 feet in a living room
One window should open into open space
Window area should be 1/5th of floor area

questions.solution:
The windows in the living room must be at a height of not more than 3 feet above the floor.

choices.text: Roof not less than 10 feet from the ground

questions.text: Which of the following is not a rural housing standard in India?

choices.text: Built-up area should not exceed 1/3rd of total area
Window area should be 10% of floor area

questions.solution:
One room with sufficient space is not a rural housing standard in India.

According to rural housing standards, there must be at least two living rooms.

Rural housing standards are:

  • At least two living rooms
  • Ample verandah space
  • Separate kitchen with space for washing utensils
  • Built-up area should not exceed 1/3rd of total area
  • Sanitary latrine
  • Window area should be 10% of floor area
  • Sanitary well or tube well within quarter mile(400 m) of house
  • Cattle sheds must be 25 feet away from the house
  • Adequate arrangements for disposal of waste water, refuse and garbage

questions.text: While recording the detailed history of a patient with symptoms of tuberculosis, you note that his home is overcrowded. According to the accepted standard against overcrowding, how many people can 3 rooms accommodate?
questions.solution:
The accepted standard against overcrowding for 3 rooms is 5 persons.

Overcrowding is considered to exist if 2 persons over 9 years of age, not husband and wife, of opposite sexes are obliged to sleep in the same room.

The accepted standards against overcrowding are as follows:

No of rooms  No of persons
1 room 2 persons
2 rooms 3 persons
3 rooms 5 persons
4 rooms 7 persons
5 rooms 10 persons (1 room for every 2 additional persons)

The floor space standards against overcrowding are as follows:

Area No of persons
110 sq. ft. and more 2 persons
90 – 100 sq. ft. 1 ½ persons (Children from 1 – 10 are counted as a half unit)
70 – 90 sq. ft. 1 person
50 – 70 sq. ft. ½ person

questions.solution:
To avoid overcrowding, the minimum area required per person in a house is 70 - 90 sq. ft.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an organization related to housing in India?
questions.solution:
National Rural Housing Services is not an organization related to housing in India.

Rural Housing Services is an agency of the United States Department of Agriculture located in Washington, D.C.

The organizations related to housing in India are:

  • National Buildings Organization (NBO).
  • National Buildings Construction Corporation Ltd.
  • Housing and Urban Development Corporation (HUDCO).
  • Hindustan Housing Factory.

They work under the Union Ministry of works and Housing to deal with various aspects of housing.

questions.text: Which of the following was launched to address rural housing in India?
questions.solution:
The Indira Awas Yojana was launched in 1985 to address rural housing in India.

It is now called the Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awaas Yojana (2015), which is a social welfare flagship programme created to provide housing to the rural poor in India.

A similar scheme called Housing for All by 2022 or Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana (Urban) was begun to address housing for the urban poor.

Option A: Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojana is an unemployment protection scheme. 

Option B: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana was begun for the recognition and standardization of skills among the youth.

Option C: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana is an agricultural scheme.
